PageTitle: peer ip-prefix import (BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view) (IPv6)
FuncDef:
The peer ip-prefix import command configures a policy based on an IP prefix list for filtering BGP routes received from a specified peer.
The undo peer ip-prefix import command cancels this configuration. The peer ip-prefix import command configures a policy based on an IP prefix list for filtering BGP routes received from a specified peer. The undo peer ip-prefix import command cancels this configuration. By default, no route filtering policy based on an IP address prefix list is configured for a peer. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a peer.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the name of an IP prefix list.
The name is a string of 1 to 169 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Applies a filtering policy to the routes received from a peer.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] ip ip-prefix prefix1 permit 10.1.1.1 8 greater-equal 17 less-equal 18
ExtraInfo: The peer ip-prefix import command can be used to configure a route filtering policy that is based on an IP prefix list for filtering BGP routes to be received from a specified peer, implementing route control.
